body_html: @girving Sorry, should have been clearer. Is the fix python only? If so, would I be able to just use the corrected python module instead of the standard module without rebuilding the rest of the source? (The issue is that our cluster runs with an old CentOs with an old glibc, so the sysadmins have to do a ton of work to get tensorflow to build, so it's infeasible for us to use binaries or rebuild except at stable releases).

body: @girving Sorry, should have been clearer. Is the fix python only? If so, would I be able to just use the corrected python module instead of the standard module without rebuilding the rest of the source? (The issue is that our cluster runs with an old CentOs with an old glibc, so the sysadmins have to do a ton of work to get tensorflow to build, so it's infeasible for us to use binaries or rebuild except at stable releases).
